unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Admissions Test
question_text: State University applicants are required to take an admission test for entrance into the university. In a given year, $850\text{ applicants}$ took the test, and the mean score was $68$ with a standard deviation of $4\text{ points}$ . Suppose we do not know if the scores are approximately normally distributed. What can be said about the number of scores that are less than $60$ (to the nearest integer)?

choices.text: At most 2 2 of the scores are less than 60 60 .
At least 20 20 of the scores are less than 60 60 .
Exactly 0.0228 0.0228 of the scores are less than 60 60 .
At least 637 637 of the scores are less than 60 60 .
At most 213 213 of the scores are less than 60 60 .
